abstract: If JPMorgan had more clearly broken out its hedging activity, investors might have asked questions about what was going on at the chief investment office well before its $2 billion-plus trading loss became public.

lead_paragraph: So many questions still dangle over JPMorgan Chase’s disastrous credit bet. Here is one more: Why is it so hard to find answers in the bank’s public financial filings?
